polarimeter/channel.documentation:

FIELD_NAME: channel
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True

polarimeter/channel/line_of_sight.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: polarimeter/channel/line_of_sight
IDS: polarimeter
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: polarimeter/channel
FIELD_NAME: line_of_sight
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: polarimeter -> channel -> line_of_sight

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Description of the line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[polarimeter]: Polarimeter diagnostic
CONTAINER[polarimeter/channel]: Set of channels (lines-of-sight)

polarimeter/channel/faraday_angle/validi.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: polarimeter/channel/faraday_angle/validity_timed
IDS: polarimeter
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: polarimeter/channel/faraday_angle
FIELD_NAME: validity_timed
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: polarimeter -> channel -> faraday_angle -> validity_timed

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[polarimeter]: Polarimeter diagnostic
CONTAINER[polarimeter/channel]: Set of channels (lines-of-sight)
CONTAINER[polarimeter/channel/faraday_angle]: Faraday angle (variation of the Faraday angle induced by crossing the plasma)

=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: polarimeter/channel/faraday_angle/validity
IDS: polarimeter
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: polarimeter/channel/faraday_angle
FIELD_NAME: validity
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: polarimeter -> channel -> faraday_angle -> validity

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[polarimeter]: Polarimeter diagnostic
CONTAINER[polarimeter/channel]: Set of channels (lines-of-sight)
CONTAINER[polarimeter/channel/faraday_angle]: Faraday angle (variation of the Faraday angle induced by crossing the plasma)
